question.similarQuestions: [{"title": "Minimum Window Substring", "titleSlug": "minimum-window-substring", "difficulty": "Hard", "translatedTitle": null}, {"title": "Min Stack", "titleSlug": "min-stack", "difficulty": "Easy", "translatedTitle": null}, {"title": "Longest Substring with At Most Two Distinct Characters", "titleSlug": "longest-substring-with-at-most-two-distinct-characters", "difficulty": "Hard", "translatedTitle": null}, {"title": "Paint House II", "titleSlug": "paint-house-ii", "difficulty": "Hard", "translatedTitle": null}]
question.content:
Given an array nums, there is a sliding window of size k which is moving from the very left of the array to the very right. You can only see the k numbers in the window. Each time the sliding window moves right by one position. Return the max sliding window.

Example:

Input: nums = [1,3,-1,-3,5,3,6,7], and k = 3
Output: [3,3,5,5,6,7] 
Explanation: 

Window position                Max
---------------               -----
[1  3  -1] -3  5  3  6  7       3
 1 [3  -1  -3] 5  3  6  7       3
 1  3 [-1  -3  5] 3  6  7       5
 1  3  -1 [-3  5  3] 6  7       5
 1  3  -1  -3 [5  3  6] 7       6
 1  3  -1  -3  5 [3  6  7]      7

Note:
You may assume k is always valid, 1 ≤ k ≤ input array's size for non-empty array.

Follow up:
Could you solve it in linear time?
